oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: James Knox Polk ancestral home
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: This photograph shows the James Knox Polk Ancestral Home in Columbia, Tennessee.

The James K. Polk ancestral home is located in Columbia, Tennessee. It was built by James K. Polk's father, Samuel Polk, in 1816. The residence is the only house other than the White House in which James K. Polk lived that is still standing. The house remained in the Polk family for many years, and passed through several owners before it was acquired by the state of Tennessee in 1929. It is now a historic house museum. It is managed by the Tennessee Historical Commission and the museum is operated by the James K. Polk Association.
